climbs.name: Zeitgeist
climbs.fa: Eric Hörst, Charles Ganote, Cindy Hintz (2003)

content.description:
An extension to Crescendo that includes the big roof above.

Climb Crescendo to within a few feet of the anchor, then veer right through the overhangs on jugs to another anchor.
content.protection: 10 bolts + 2-bolt anchor.  60M rope handy (Not sure if it's required to lower off.  We had one, so I had no problem).
content.location: Same as Crescendo, at the far right side of the Shady Lady alcove, just left of a large fallen block.

content.description: Climb the slightly overhanging right side of the arete.
content.protection: Guidebook says 5 bolts but I think we only found 4. Double bolted anchor
content.location: To the left of the decameron on the broken boulder.

content.description:
After successfully sending

Lieback and Enjoy It

, continue up and out multi-tiered roof. At the lip, keep the pump at bay, solve technical crux, clip, and head to the anchors. (Goods holds at crux, though moves are sequential.)

A fun route!
content.protection:
4 additional bolts from the top of

Lieback.

11 bolts in all.

Anchors

Note: Bolt

below

roof lip needs a longer draw for rock clearance and to avoid rope drag.
content.location:
Route extends out roof from the top of

Lieback and Enjoy It.

climbs.name: Shady Lady
climbs.fa: Charles Ganote, Cindy Hintz, Eric Hörst (2003)

content.description:
This climb is the first you encounter in a neat little section of Sandstonia that is separated from the rest of the cliff by large blocks at either end.  This little alcove is often quieter then the western side of the cliff and affords nice views of the river.  The cave-like hole created by a large block 50 feet right of this climb creates a cool place to hide or eat lunch in the summer.

Start on the broken face just left the dihedral in some cracks (takes gear, but only a new 5.7 leader might feel uncomfortable without it). Climb the broken face, passing a roof on the left and continue up and right on the nice face to a small ledge and the anchors.  You can TR the adjacent route (Lieback and Enjoy It, 5.10d) from this anchor with a directional or 2.

A fun easy route on cool rock.
content.location: At a dihedral, just past where the cliff juts out creating a narrow section of the trail (just past the prominent flake and corner of Butterfly Flake and Plumber's Corner).

content.description: This is the route for those chasing the 5.13a grade.   Climb up some ledges to reach the first bolt and head left on to the arete.   Climb up to the 3rd bolt and shake out.   From here, climb the arete, pinching your way to the 4th bolt (crux).   After the 4th bolt, continue out right on to the face over easier terrain to the anchors.
content.location: From the Tattoo Wall (Sandstonia Left), continue up stream passing the Bikini Line, 5.11c area.  Just before the trail drops down and around the cliff, look for a short arete on white rock.   This climb is on the arete between Plumber's Crack, 5.6 and White Henna, 5.12b.

content.description: easy romp up wide right facing corner/crack. crux at last bolt, small roof.
content.protection: One bolt at the ledge at 3/4 height, and bolted anchors.  The bulk of the route takes gear from .75 to 4".

content.description: Same first bolt and anchors as Butterfly Flake. Tackle the left bolt line.
content.location: Between Mike Tyson's Face and Butterfly Flake.

content.description: Start behind the left end of a large triangular detached block. Pull a roof followed by face moves to another smaller roof. Move left to gain the anchors.
content.protection:
This route has 6 bolts and bolted anchors shared with

Bass Ackwards

.
content.location:
Near the right end of Sandstonia and located behind the left edge of a very large detached flake between

The Bitter End

on the right and

Bass Ackwards

on the left.

climbs.name: Mrs. Field's Follies
climbs.fa: Eric Hörst, Cindy Hintz, Charles Ganote (2003)

content.description: Start at the same wide crack as Geisha Girl.  Look for the first bolt heading right at the top of the crack.  If you have a long stick, clipping the first from the ground is recommended.  The climbing turns to sequential, slightly less than vertical climbing past several bolts until the holds become larger and you reach a stance under the roof.  Long reaches to really big holds will get you over the roof and to the anchor.
content.location: Same as Geisha Girl, at a wide crack just right of the starting block of Bobby D's Bunny

content.description: start on overhanging face. tackle bulge, then push though the one-two punch crux. it backs off after that one grade or so.

climbs.name: Lord of the Jungle
climbs.fa: Kenny Parker, Kevin Parker, John Regelbrugge, 1987

content.description: This route stays dry in a light rain.  Climb up broken rock to reach the arete to the left of the crack system.  Climb up the arete to reach the crack and follow it to the thin hands section and a great hand jam.  Plug some gear in the thin hands section.   From here, make a reach to a horizontal jug and keep going on pumpy but positive holds to the finish.
content.protection: Nothing larger than a #1 Camalot. .75 Camalots for sure. A few nuts or small cams (< .5"). Bolted anchors.
content.location: At the right end of the Sandstonia Area, locate the obvious overhanging crack system on the underside of a detached pillar.

climbs.name: Layback and Enjoy It
climbs.fa: Eric Hörst, Charles Ganote, Cindy Hintz (2003)

content.description: A fun climb with 2 cruxes.  Boulder up to a ledge (crux 1), the up the dihedral to an awkward exit (crux 2) and the anchors.
content.location: The next bolt line right of Shady Lady and first bolt line on the south-facing face in this alcove, just right of a dihedral.

content.description:
60m Rope Necessary.

Fluid, Flowing climb, many many 5.10 moves, no moves below 5.7 but only one 5.10c move, coming out of the  roof and pulling the blinding(sunny) move above.

Ultra-Classic!!!
content.protection: 8 bolts to anchors, bring a couple of extendables for below the roof.
content.location: Second climb on the super tall orange wall. follows corners through the bottom to high roof.

content.description: Begin by climbing up the big chimney near the tornado feature. Pass through the "jaws" (pulling through a roof) and up to a ledge. Finish up the face all the way to the anchors.
content.location: To the right of Climb Free or Die

content.description: Fun, short, crimpy route. Feels like a bolted boulder problem. The crux is holding a swing after grabbing two crimps, then becomes really easy up to the anchors.
content.location: Just to the right of Centennial and shares anchors.

content.description: Uninspiring bottom, leads pass a short crux to a juggy and enjoyable top. Follow left leaning crack to first bolt then continue up over two small roofs to top. Crux is at second small roof.
content.location: Second bolt line Right of Geisha Girl and Ms. Fields Follies obvious starting crack.

content.description:
If you are desperate or just curious then do this climb, otherwise stay away.

This route wanders through three mini roofs doing strange moves and wandering at times quite far off the bolt line.

Don't waste your time on this one, there are too many other classic lines at this cliff.
content.protection:
4 bolts to anchors, Who Bolted This??

I am by no means a bolting expert, but I know that some of the bolts of this climb could/should have been placed in better locations!
content.location: 1st climb you'll reach at this cliff. (Far left, short wall)

content.description: This route is a bit blocky and a little pumpy. I think the crux is getting from the vertical stance to the slabby crack, about 40 feet up.
content.location: Between Layback and Enjoy It and Crescendo

content.description: Climb the right-trending wide crack to a stance, then head left to the first bolt.  Follow 10 more bolts on mostly low angle rock with some high stepping bulge moves up and left to anchors at the top just below the rim.
content.protection: High first bolt.  A #4 (or #5 higher in the crack) Camalot protects the crack rather well if you don't have a long stick clip to reach the first bolt.  11 bolts + bolted anchor.  60 M rope.
content.location: At an obvious wide crack to the right of the opening block of Bobby D's Bunny.

content.description: Some hard sequences with some good rests in between.  Climb Bikini Line to the 4th bolt then move right around/over and overlap.  Balance up a clean face and then through fun and easier steep moves above to the anchor.
content.location: Same start as Bikini Line.

content.description:
Begin in chimney and commence up right face through broken crack system and trend left around blocky bulge to base of dihedral (handcrack). Traverse left onto face, make a challenging clip, head for the arete (crux), and follow it to the top.

Nice exposure and beautiful view.

(Crux - inspect and strategize thoroughly, it's all there.)
content.location: Far right side of Sandstonia Wall, past Shady Lady (5.7) alcove, around corner, through slot, past Witches of Bangor (10c), begins in corner chimney.

climbs.name: Crescendo
climbs.fa: Eric Hörst, Cindy Hintz, Charles Ganote (2003)

content.description:
This climb is very well named !

Climb the nice face past increasingly hard moves to the anchor.  An excellent climb.

Continue up past the anchors to finish on

Zeitgeist
content.protection: 6 bolts + 2-bolt anchor. Shares anchor with The Good Book to the left.
content.location: At the far right side of the Shady Lady alcove, just left of a large fallen block.

content.description: Obvious double crack feature to a roof with an awesome hand size crack over a bulge and to a tree (Tree can be seen from the ground slightly left of the crack). The tree had a sling with a rap ring as of 11/24/2019.
content.protection: Double 2's and 3's are nice. Leads to a Tree with sling and rap ring. Consider having a sling to leave behind.
content.location: Passing "The Good Book" continue down the trail as it turns right and goes down hill, look left for the obvious crack feature. If you made the left turn around the buttress, you have gone to far.

content.description: This might be a good first 5.11d for someone breaking into the grade.   It boils down to one move with easier climbing before and after.   Climb up to reach the overhang.  Get setup on 2 small holds and make a big move to a jug (crux).   From here, make a few delicate moves and then it's smooth sailing to the top.
content.location: From the Tattoo Wall (Sandstonia Left), head up stream along the cliff.   As the trail begins to head up hill slightly, look for the clean orange section of rock.   (Nicest section of stone at this area).  This line is the 2nd from the left in this beautiful section of rock.

content.description:
"Climb the short, but tricky L-facing dihedral to shared anchors" (Horst).

Takes some time to figure out a good beta.

Bowling ball-sized loose block around the first bolt.
content.location: Around 20 feet right and slightly downhill from The Decameron. Shares anchors with ISO9000 next to it on the right.

content.description: Two roofs through wierd moves and some strange moves above with underclings and rounded crimps.
content.protection: 5 bolts to out of sight anchors
content.location: 2nd route you come to walking south along this cliff, on the shorter section of  cliff.

content.description: Be it for beginning leaders, or an easy warm-up for the more experienced, this is a neat little route. Follow generous holds and the beautiful right-facing flake to the top.
content.location: The right-most route of Tattoo Wall proper. Just LEFT of the ramping route, Plumber's Crack (5.6). Look for the obvious flake midway up.

content.description: I think the crux is the beginning of the climb going through G-String. At the 3rd bold of G-String step right and join up with Clean Shaved at the fourth bolt.
content.location: Same start as G-String and Bikini Line.

content.description: Looks ugly from the ground, but once past the opening moves and onto the face the climbing is quite nice.
content.location: Begin on the obvious large block just right of Five-Five My Ass and about 20 feet right of the right side of the cliff.

content.description: Fun climbing leading to a bolt under and right of the roof. Step left get a good sit down rest and fire the roof.
content.location: Shares the start with G-String and Booby Prize. Starts a bit right of the wet dripping spot.

content.description:
This route starts 20 feet right of the chimney (which is the start for Decameron), behind the tree.

Your first good gear is at a short splitter crack. Back up your first piece because you’re about to run it out a little ways. Gently trend up and right until you find a horizontal crack. Continue up until you reach the ledge. Off of the ledge begins finger/hand crack with rounded out edges, flares and pods. You’ll want stoppers, small cams, and a  #3 BD Camalot.

At the top of the splitter crack is a devious roof which I found to be the crux of the route.

Rest and get ready to pull up over the second roof on good jugs.

Exit the last small roof on lichen covered holds and amble up blocky, 5th class terrain until you top out on the cliff rim.

Descent: I didn’t have enough rope to rap the route with a 60m. Ideally you would bring your partner up in reverse and then you could carefully Walk climbers left (skiers right) to the top of the Decameron and rap down to the ledge where Decameron tops out. From here you can pull your rope and comfortably rap down from a slung tree.

A simple alternative would be to tag another rope up with you, sling a pine tree and double rope rap.
content.protection:
Cams from BD 00-3

Full set of tricams
content.location:
20 feet right of Decameron in a crack system behind the tree.

*You’ll notice that a little further to the right is another crack system; this route goes at 5.8.

Bubba City

Sandstonia

content.description: Left of a huge flake you'll climb up and to the right on a slab.  Shares an anchor with Pay it Forward.
Begin at the flakes (one has an X on it) and climb up through the two first bolts of Badass Tattoo. From the second bolt, continue straight up the steep face and into a corner and up to anchor.
content.location: Right of Hep-C, same start as Badass Tattoo finishing left of that line, and downhill from G-String et al.

content.description: Good 5.10 climb up to/through roof near the top. Some flake and lie back climbing.
content.location: About 30 feet to the right of Geisha Girl crack.

content.description:
Start on

5.5 My Ass

, move past loose blocks and crux of that route, then veer left after 3rd bolt to Celtic Sun anchors.

Not really worth doing.
content.location: Same as Five-five My Ass.

content.description: Small roof near the beginning leads to good stemming through the 'X' marked blocks to the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts, great beginner route with awesome clipping holds.
content.location: Shares the same start as Ass Man, then goes right through much easier ground.
